current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To grant the Secretary of the Interior permanent
		  authority to authorize States to issue electronic duck stamps, and for other
		  purposes.

header.#text:
Authority to
			 issue electronic duck stamps

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may authorize any State to issue electronic stamps in accordance with this Act.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall implement this section in consultation with State management agencies.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may not authorize a State to issue electronic stamps under this Act unless the
has received and approved an application submitted by the State in accordance with this section. The
may determine the number of new States per year to participate in the electronic stamp program.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may not approve a State application unless the application contains—

text.#text: This section shall not apply to the State portion of any fee collected by a State under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: in issuing electronic stamps under this Act, including costs of delivery of actual stamps.

text.#text: A State authorized to issue electronic stamps may charge a reasonable fee to cover costs incurred by the State and the

A State authorized to issue electronic stamps
			 may issue a duplicate electronic stamp to replace an electronic stamp issued by
			 the State that is lost or damaged.

A State may not
			 require that an individual purchase a State hunting license as a condition of
			 issuing an electronic stamp under this Act.

header.#text:
Limitation on
			 Authority To Require Purchase of State License

Electronic stamp
			 requirements; recognition of electronic stamp

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall require an electronic stamp issued by a State under this Act—

text.#text: The

to have the same
			 format as any other license, validation, or privilege the State issues under
			 the automated licensing system of the State; and

to specify
			 identifying features of the licensee that are adequate to enable Federal,
			 State, and other law enforcement officers to identify the holder.

Any electronic stamp issued by a State under
			 this Act shall, during the effective period of the electronic stamp—

bestow upon the
			 licensee the same privileges as are bestowed by an actual stamp;

authorize the
			 licensee to hunt migratory waterfowl in any other State, in accordance with the
			 laws of the other State governing that hunting.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , which shall not exceed 45 days.
